intro: Terpsichore subscabra, commonly known as the rough-stemmed terpsichore, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered umbels of white to pale yellow flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and have a rough texture, contributing to its common name. It is native to regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky and arid environments. This plant is often found in open woodlands and along rocky outcrops, where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
